alert.note: Alert for Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:31PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Moffat and northwestern Rio Blanco Counties through 400 PM MDT... At 331 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dinosaur, or 33 miles southeast of Vernal, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dinosaur around 350 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 14. U.S. Highway 40 in Utah between mile markers 172 and 174. Colorado 64 between mile markers 1 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
